alert.note: Alert for Lake Mead National Recreation Area (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 19 at 8:56AM MST until April 19 at 9:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT /9 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. A few gusts around 60 mph possible near Red Rock Canyon. * WHERE...Most of Clark and southern Nye counties in southern Nevada, as well as the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. This includes the Las Vegas metro area. * WHEN...Until 9 PM today. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Dangerous boating conditions expected on Lake Mead and Lake Mohave due to high wave activity. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While the highest wind gusts are expected to be occuring above 5000 feet, a few gusts could reach Red Rock Canyon and Mountain Springs with gusts over 60 mph at times. Areas on the west side of the Las Vegas Valley like Summerlin and Mountains Edge will likely see higher wind gusts compared to the rest of the Valley but should stay at or below the 50 mph range.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
